intro: Stenandrium guatemalense, commonly known as the Guatemalan stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and other tropical trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in humid, lowland forests and is often found in secondary vegetation. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
